The UC Davis School of Education, Yolo County Office of Education, REEd at UC Davis School of Education, and the UC Davis Graduate Group in Education are hosting a Zoom Webinar on Ensuring Support for Racial Equity in Schools. This FREE online forum is open to school district administrators, principals, teachers, and community members.

Date: Monday, August 17, 2020
Time: 1:00 pm to 2:15 pm
Register for the Webinar: https://t.e2ma.net/click/6t2mvc/2ife3n/ese5ah

The COVID-19 pandemic and the nationwide reckoning about institutional racism have cast a bright light on longstanding inequities in our educational system.

Join the webinar to hear from UC Davis experts about the latest research into educational disparities for Black and Latinx students, systemic challenges to creating change, and ways that schools and community members can support each other to improve all student outcomes.

‚ÑπÔ∏èAs COVID-19 continues to dominate headlines both locally and abroad, it can impact your emotional well-being as well as physical health. The heightened focus on the current pandemic and the multitude of challenges it creates can build up a lot of stress, fear, and anxiety among a variety of other social and emotional responses.

It is important for us all to remember to prioritize our own well-being during this difficult time. Everyone reacts differently, but signs of distress can include changes in eating, sleeping, energy level, and mood. Dear WUSD Staff and Families,

We want to provide you with information regarding an upcoming City of West Sacramento, Government Construction project in the Stonegate Elementary school neighborhood. This project will be located at the intersection of Village Parkway and Bear River Court. Please see attached for additional information on the location of improvements.

The work involved in this project will include installing flashing beacons, enhancing crosswalk striping and visibility, as well as installation of signs and advanced notification.
Currently, the City of West Sacramento is planning to begin and complete from December 27th to January 31st.

If you have any questions or comments, or if you would like any additional information please contact: ryant@cityofwestsacramento.org or 916-617-4665.
